DOC.brief_summary: This study involves treatment with KD019 or erlotinib in patients with Non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who have progressed after first- or second- line chemotherapy. It is hypothesized that KD019 can prolong survival compared with erlotinib.
DOC.brief_title: KD019 Versus Erlotinib in Subjects With Stage IIIB/IV Non Small Cell Lung Cancer With Progression After First- or Second-Line Chemotherapy
DOC.criteria: For Eligibility subjects must have: failed one or two previous courses of therapy. have no active brain metastasis. Treated nonactive brain metastasis are acceptable. cannot have received an Epidermal Growth Factor Receptors inhibitor (Tarceva [erlotinib] or Iressa [gefitinib]) in the past. has demonstrated progressive disease.
